author: craigmcc
msg: Mention Xerces as a parser that works well with Struts.
Submitted by: Vadim Shun <VShun@newcorp.com>

author: craigmcc
msg: Avoid cases where the custom tag class modifies an instance variable that
can be set from a custom tag attribute.  Doing this violates the contract
with the JSP engine that allows it to reuse custom tag instances as long
as they have exactly the same attribute values -- the engine has no way to
know that you changed something underneath the covers.
(You learn something new every day -- thanks to Jen Hsien Huang for this
one!)

author: craigmcc
msg: Make the "value" attribute of <struts:multibox> accept runtime expressions,
so that you can do things like this:
for (int i = 0; i < sendInfoLabels.length; i++) {
<struts:multibox property="sendInfo" value="<%= sendInfoValues[i] %>">
<%= sendInfoLabels[i]%>
</struts:multibox>
Submitted by: Jen Hsien Huang <u5321007@ncnu.edu.tw>

author: craigmcc
msg: Correct a doubled </attribute> in struts.tld.  Funny that Tomcat didn't catch
that, even though it's using a validating parser for the TLD.
